Bash(git commit -m "fix: bundle knowledge base (objects/) into VSIX for user installations

Critical fix for type inference in production:

Problem:
- objects/ folder only exists in development
- Users installing VSIX don''t have objects/*.md files
- Type inference completions would fail silently

Solution:
- Pass extensionPath from VSCode extension to LSP server
- BuiltInMethodsLoader now supports 3 path strategies:
  1. Workspace root (for testing with local objects/)
  2. Extension path (for bundled VSIX)
  3. Fallback to relative path from __dirname

Technical Changes:
- Updated: languageClient.ts - Pass extensionPath via initializationOptions
- Updated: server.ts - Extract extensionPath from params.initializationOptions
- Updated: BuiltInMethodsLoader - Smart path resolution with fs.existsSync
- Updated: CompletionProvider - Accept extensionPath parameter

Now objects/ folder will be bundled into VSIX and accessible to all users!")

Bash(git commit -m "fix: exclude objects/ and docs/ from workspace indexing

Problem:
- WorkspaceIndexer was scanning ALL directories including objects/, docs/
- MD files and examples were being parsed as PML code
- Random words from documentation appeared in completions

Solution:
- Added excludedDirs list: objects, docs, scripts, .git, .vscode
- Now only actual PML code files (.pml, .pmlfrm, etc.) are indexed
- MD files are only used by BuiltInMethodsLoader for type-specific methods

v0.5.2 fix")

Bash(git commit -m "fix: add explicit output channel for PML Language Server

Issue:
- Output channel ''PML Language Server'' not appearing in production
- Works in debug mode (F5) but not when installed as VSIX
- Makes debugging difficult for users

Solution:
- Added outputChannelName: ''PML Language Server'' to clientOptions
- Added revealOutputChannelOn setting
- Now Output channel will be created on extension activation

v0.5.2")

Bash(git commit -m "chore: fix package.json warnings

- Removed empty email field from author
- Removed activationEvents (VSCode auto-generates from contributes)

Fixes validation warnings in package.json")
